function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Integration of digital technology may compromise privacy and data security.","Impact":"Potential for privacy breaches and data leaks leading to loss of sensitive information.","Mitigation":"Implement robust data encryption and privacy protection measures, and regularly audit data security protocols.","Technologies":"Data encryption, secure data storage, and privacy protection software.","People":"Users of digital health platforms, individuals providing personal data for contact tracing, and healthcare organizations storing patient information.","Owner":"Technology developers, data security professionals, and healthcare organizations."},{"Description":"Relying solely on digital technology for pandemic policy and response may lead to a false sense of security.","Impact":"Inadequate containment and mitigation efforts due to overreliance on digital solutions, leading to a resurgence of infections.","Mitigation":"Combine digital technology with traditional public health measures, such as testing, surveillance, and clinical management, to ensure comprehensive response.","Technologies":"Integration of digital health platforms with traditional public health infrastructure and resources.","People":"Government officials, public health authorities, and policymakers responsible for pandemic response.","Owner":"Public health agencies, government authorities, and policymakers."},{"Description":"Unequal access to digital technology may exacerbate disparities in pandemic response and containment.","Impact":"Increased risk of underrepresentation and inadequate support for marginalized communities, leading to higher infection rates in vulnerable populations.","Mitigation":"Ensure equitable access to digital health solutions and provide alternative support for communities with limited digital infrastructure.","Technologies":"Equitable distribution of digital health resources, community outreach programs, and alternative communication channels.","People":"Marginalized communities, individuals with limited access to digital technology, and underprivileged populations.","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, community leaders, and government initiatives."}]}
